topic.title: (Concept) BlueMaxima's Flashpoint webgame preservation project port/mirror on Zeronet
topic.body: Just checking if it would be possible and what do you think about such project.

topic.title: How Big?
topic.body:
I was wondering, do we have any estimation about how big the whole zeronet is? How fast does it grow?
Do we have any statistics about it?

1584808018_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body: It can be but I would strongly advise you not to coz your activity could be crosreferenced easier, just start separate tor instance for that. Or run your own exit node and blend in with the crowd.

1592403341_12MBVCw8iNrKvgTrV5NMPtPf6Z5V2.body:
ZeroMail could be adopted to support "Play-by-mail games" 

external link to games list that support this game mode:
https://www.mobygames.com/attribute/sheet/attributeId,1407/offset,0/so,0a/

There are some cool ones like:
Capitalism Plus
Empire II: The Art of War
Sid Meier's Civilization series
Age of Wonders Series

1591776814_1EisAdDMyEXWtPiKWM8t4wme5yXX1.body:
You want to silence a democratically chosen president?
That's not justice that's crime against democracy.

1594361535_17WS8Y1keB3p8ELXFPbX1ZRLfeCES.body:

I don't think yacy can crawl zeronet yet. It can crawl freenet just fine tho.

1580289800_1GDtf6kkYiCtruw42QmAeaHG1HsrW.body: cool USA antichinese propaganda you've got there m8

1594475002_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2.body:
If it's not bundled with adware, spyware, free toolbar and a McAfee soon it will be.
Just like every other "freeware" p2p program before like Kaaza, Bearshare, Limewire and Napster.

What makes you think this time it will be different?

1596079219_1LVZEMhitcYT5Q7bw5Hy9qWURWK5U.body: could you also mirror it onto zeronet?

1596096685_18yZKKFySP5bvmNy14T9vgj3H99AC.body:
For search engine try YaCy it has a shared p2p database created by independent crawlers you can also participate in crawling yourself.

As for video sharing maybe peertube. I'm not quite sold on it just yet but you can even set up your own instance and follow other instances as you please. I've heard some interesting ideas about zeronet - peertube bridges but there hasn't been anything that came out of this idea yet. 

Jeśli chodzi o szukajki to spróbuj Yacy, ma współdzieloną bazę po sieci p2p tworzoną przez niezależne roboty indeksujące. W przeszukiwaniu i indeksowaniu sieci możesz też sam brać udział.

Co do dzielenia się filmikami spróbuj peertube. Nie jestem co prawda do końca jeszcze przekonany ale możesz nawet postawić własną instancję i podłączać instancję innych. Słyszałem też o pomysłach by robić mosty zeronet – peertube ale nie wiem czy to nie skończyło się tylko na pomyśle.

1596264833_1CQ14MAUEp55ijU6rQLQ9vZdzxCQe.body:
> [driud](#comment_74_18yZKKFySP5bvmNy14T9vgj3H99AC1PQkH): In the tab, you have given numbers to which you can get connected.. Connected. - 7,. Onion, -773,. In total, - 6670,. Possible up to, - 6664,. Local, - 10.This is today's result..W zakładce, masz podane liczby do których możesz uzyskać połaczenie.. Połączony. - 7,. Onion, -773,. Sumarycznie, - 6670,. Możliwy  do, - 6664,.  Localne, - 10.To wynik dzisiejszy.

but these are your personal statistics not the network as a whole

ale to są twoje statystki a nie statystyki całej sieci

> [otbtechnologies7](#comment_2_1BULx3pdbqxqTWCSBvSQijujiHhXJT1D3w):  My business sells products and promotes services that ensure freedom of speech

I find selling freedom as a product disgusting.

> [otbtechnologies7](#comment_10_1BULx3pdbqxqTWCSBvSQijujiHhXJT1D3w): I think maybe you are misunderstanding how American society works maybe... Just my 2 cents

> [otbtechnologies7](#comment_12_1BULx3pdbqxqTWCSBvSQijujiHhXJT1D3w): So, you are telling me that you are against me utilizing my 10+ years of experience fighting Big Tech and Big Government corruption to make JUST enough money to feed myself?... Odd..

I think you've just answered yourself how american society "works".
That a man with 10+ years of skill and experience can barely feed himself.

Putting that aside my initial idea of this thread was to estimate the initial cost of "super node" to funnel zeronet into internet independent mesh networks like network 44, yggdrasil or cjdns. After the initial funeling we could dismantle super node into smaller nodes furthers spliting the cost among users inside mesh network.

> [driud](#comment_81_18yZKKFySP5bvmNy14T9vgj3H99AC1PQkH): At the moment the statistics are;ZeroName; 12,422 - computers on.globally; 11 597. - this is how many calls can be made.This data depends on the day and time / time of day /.These are the facts, at a different time, there are different data..W tej chwili statystyki wynoszą;ZeroName; 12 422. - włączonych komputerów.Sumarycznie;  11 597. - tyle mozna wykonać połączeń.Te dane zależą od dnia i godziny, / pora dnia /.Takie są fakty, o innej godzinie, są inne dane.

But that doesn't say anything about size in PB. And that's what i'm trying to estimate.
Ale to nie mówi nic o rozmiarze w PB a właśnie to chce określić.

> [driud](#comment_82_18yZKKFySP5bvmNy14T9vgj3H99AC1PQkH): This is the average load, Zeroneta, There are those who do not turn off the computer. There are those that turn it off. And a different time zone causes variation, so you should consider this an average, not a constant number of users..Jest to średnia obciążenia, Zeroneta, Są tacy co nie wyłączają kompa. Są tacy co go wyłączają. A inna strefa czasowa powoduje zróżnicowanie.Trzeba to traktować jako średnią, a nie stałą ilości użytkowników.

Chodzi mi o rozmiar przestrzeni dyskowej w PB - petabajtach wygenerowanych przez tych wszystkich urzytkowników a nie ilu tych użytkowników jest. Chyba że przyjęlibyśmy jakąś liczbę danych które generuje przeciętny użytkownik i w ten sposób to przeliczyć.

I'm talking about disk space in PB - petabytes genereted by all those users not about number of users. Unless we could estimate amount of data generated by average user and calculate it that way.

> [otbtechnologies7](#comment_13_1BULx3pdbqxqTWCSBvSQijujiHhXJT1D3w): Do you by chance live in a Socialist or Communist country?

But don't you think P2P networks are inherently socialistic? There is no one person or company that can claim possession over the data inside, we're all owning it and redistributing it as a collective.

1596566014_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKz.body:

1597273154_1DnpB2yFpVwyhA29h2rRsifGVEC1s.body:
There are some gaming stuff that can be done over zeronet:
-leader boards exchange like twingalaxies.com
-mods and maps repository for popular games (many of this kind of sites are dying out) 
-tradicional and pen and paper play-by-mail-games (like chess and even rpgs with a Game Master)
-digital play-by-email games like Age of Wonders, Sid's Meier's Civilisation, Capitalism Plus

Są rzeczy dla graczy które dałoby się zrobić po zeronecie:
-wymiana tabeli liderów na podobe twingalaxies.com
-repozytoria z mapami i modami do popularnych gier (wiele z tych stron wymiera)
-tradycyjne gry turowe z rozwiązaniami do rozgrywki po poczcie (szachy albo i nawet gry rpg wymagające mistrza gry)
-cyfrowe gry turowe z rozwiązaniem do rozgrywki po poczcie elektronicznej takie jak Age of Wonders, Sid's Meier's Civilisation czy Capitalism Plus

> [blkdissident](#comment_5_1NH142U7sEqKGnZXg5VUFp5SPtSjdDaSwN): I'd be down to play some Civ passing a save file around

Which civ do you have?
I've got 3rd one with expansions.
But as a warning i've got to tell you that i've never played civ before so it would be more like a proof of concept that it can be done.

Którego civa masz?
Ja mam civa trójkę z dodatkami.
Jednakże muszę cię ostrzec że nigdy w civa nie grałem wiec niech to nam posłuży jako udowodnienie koncepcji że to da się zrobić.

> [marcusfinch](#comment_29_1JKZJh2XYF8C6q5p7T7FmiL3JDux2CxWyJ): The thing is, though, it works most of the time.  As long as the money is thrown in the right place.

It works as long as there is no middle-man involved between payer and creator. Only then the creator can be in charge of his/her labor.

1597908401_1GVfTPghbWnBKbRWpYpkRCKgMi4wF.body:
If at all it should be done as an external plugin/addon in which the end user can tag inappropriate content/user to his/her individual liking and moral values.

Then people could just accept which content they are comfortable with seeding. But also they could see what was "blocked" and are capable of turning it off or passing thru "false positives". So in the end it would work like filter like "Adblock" rather than an imposed censorship tool.

> [geekless](#comment_243_1GooUE19488nDwG3TdkM8seYAHct4gjkq4): Do you mean blocklists?

kinda, but automated with voting and tags

> [otbtechh22f4wcuo](#comment_3_148xLrZAr6Bjyhe6spVxJJbFHtdmwbVSCb): The only concern I have is that it would allow people to live in their own little fishbowl of a world and limit ZeroNet's use as a free speech platform, but if that is what the devs want then so be it as it is their platform not mine.

People would gravitate onto same minded groups anyhow. Speaking just English also limits you in such a way.

No, as I said I'm being suspicious.
For me being suspicious is a part of being careful. There's nothing wrong with being careful now is it?

You're also awfully short-tempered just like him.

1594775906_1ufDwJisEDriKQxYJSz2HuUhgqAG1.body: It would be a really nice foundation for recommerce craigslist-like zite. I can smell a huge potential in it.

1598405387_148xLrZAr6Bjyhe6spVxJJbFHtdmw.body:
I'd say you're not very intelligent to majority of us on zeronet.

You're calling everyone who is disagreeing with you a communist or socialist (which is funny in p2p network and in open source projects in general btw.)

All the stuff you've supposedly exposed is someone else work and it's just a bunch of long quotations and links.
You're samefaging and when it was pointed out by several users you've started to samefag even more to hide that you're samefaging. It's not gonna work. But you're also act like a hot shit because you have a business but let me tell you, burning linux dvds and selling them on ebay is not a business (YES, according to our friend otbtechnologies it takes "10+ years of experience fighting Big Tech and Big Government corruption" to burn an iso to a disc ). You DO realize that it would take ONE purchase from you to deanonymize you right? 

https://www.ebay.com/usr/otb_technologies
And all sentences in all 5 previous posts ended in "..." or emoticon. But it's not the same person. It's purely coincidental.

1598474233_19dzDaMFcuCusp4anMUPkVc8zRzLJ.body:
> [edgelordofdecent](#comment_639_1PGTHAmvu7K2PM7qqfoKyWv69aJsAaJQp5): Lol. Why do I need a specialized linux distro to do that instead of a normal one? "Advertising fees" lol

While I like the idea of dedicated linux distro (something nas/serverlike like OMV but with build in ipfs, freenet and zeronet). The "advertising" problem also bothers me to no end. We're in this censorship hell partially because people are trying to be more "advertising friendly".

1598581805_1BfrmacRWaPSuHVmRdvaMUYykqd2M.body: I'm flattered by your dedication, but why would a new user that started to post just yesterday would even care about some random drama on internet forum that happens all the time? Please explain.

That was a question to you, nekololi is here with us for much longer.

1599688609_17DFecT1rUtpofyfEvapNqRtkZ7J8.body:
> [thorburn](#comment_129_1Q2noE3qu7ccvEspqWWv4xkMktiqp6mhdK): Because that statement is fundamentally untrue. The reality is that there has not been a truly free capitalist system, the closest it may have come was probably the late 1700 and 1800's. Primarily during the development of the industrial revolution. When it was possible for individuals to develop ideas and bring them to local/national markets independently, without overreaching legislation etc

Maybe in the US after they won their independence from the British and became basically the classless society without people of the noble blood. That wasn't really the case for the rest of the world. In order to even have a chance to "develop ideas"  you would have to know how to read, have some sort of basic education and most importantly not be a peasant. As a peasant you were owned, you were someone else possession, not a free man. 

> [thorburn](#comment_129_1Q2noE3qu7ccvEspqWWv4xkMktiqp6mhdK): . The legislation crept in to restrict independent businesses from expanding, and allow larger organisations to form monopolies which could afford the expenses required to comply with legislation. Today many large corporations actually create the legislation required to protect their interests via lobbying etc. The monopolies simply buy out individual and family owned businesses, hoovering up innovation either for profit or to prevent new ideas/products from impacting existing profitable markets.

This will always end up this way, with exploitation of people, we can't pretend that human greed has any boundaries because it does not. Those "lagre corporations" already grew into such proportions that they can create laws, or treat president as a puppet. What good is president for when he has no power to do stuff he was chosen to? It's not democracy anymore.

> [thorburn](#comment_129_1Q2noE3qu7ccvEspqWWv4xkMktiqp6mhdK):  it requires the productivity of one group to be plundered in order to support another group. The plundering is managed by yet another group which decides who shall be plundered and rewarded

That's not the problem with capitalism nor socialism, it's the problem of central planing and a fact that if something gets too big it cannot be managed efficiently without creating social unrest at local levels. The USA was created in such an event. And even now you can see how coastline states are developed in comparison to how middle states are underdeveloped.

1599847995_1G4bDXzgDecBgPWKafP8J9zFGNsPe.body: Be hostile toward them also and don't use services with google captcha in them. Boycott them!

> [claude](#comment_15_1MUCEEtbLUYFpc6vqhp4F5u4ia8MJ9RGK1): Probably advocating for censorship like that one dude from a few days ago who wanted a default blocklist in ZeroNet and got dunked on in his thread. (The thread seems to have disappeared.)

You mean this one? It didn't disappear, it's unlisted. 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1600446346_1Au471PrXrTD9fdN8uQR4W93qMunb1v53S/How+to+request+a+plugin

> [krombopulusmike](#comment_30_1BfrmacRWaPSuHVmRdvaMUYykqd2MGRo5e): Children shouldn't be on these sites...

We should have kid friendly sites. Just to promote content diversity so that one day zeronet can become a 1:1 internet replacement. Without generational change this place will die within single generation.

1600039815_13UJZwpkQASN9unpc9hLhmwyauXzz.body:
> [kaffie](#comment_1146_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): There have been a few people like that. Scalpers trying to sell domains, and some people "registering them so scalpers don't get them" but then naturally those people went afk as well. So there's a lot of "dummy" entries in the registry that all point to the same site.

Cybersquating was to be expected. DNS was a mistake.

1600446346_1Au471PrXrTD9fdN8uQR4W93qMunb.body:
There is a simple difference between censorship and filtering.
Censorship is imposed on you, filtering is not.

As an example no one thinks about tools like Adblock, cookie autodelete, no-script as a form of censorship because it is not imposed, you are in control of that.

> [zeronetuser101](#comment_7_1JvFhgnYTD257iRnVk6JpzDgbkZjRKJYkD): When it is enabled by default, it is indirect censorship.

Yes, I agree with you on that part that it shouldn't be enabled by default. I think it should be as separate from zeronet project as possible like a browser plugin or as a "set of rules" for antivirus program or something like that.

> [reichama]
I wanted to tell pretty much the same but your comment was quicker. Living in eastern Europe at this time of weather season can make you depressed and it's common here.
As for vitamin D I would suggest Fish oil (tran) vitamin d needs to be dissolved in fat to be useful and fish oil does the trick.

I'm a lazy bum myself and exercise video games saved me here (wii fit and ring fit adventure) the sense of self improvement pointed out by in-game statistics were motivating enough to keep me playing/exercising regularly.

But that's just one more reason to learn it. To learn language of people you dislike. I mean what would be the chances of deciphering enigma if people didn't knew German in the first place.

I to jest jescze jeden powód więcej dla którego miałbyś się go nauczyć. Warto jest uczyć się języków ludzi których się nie lubi. Pomyśl jakie mielibyśmy szanse rozszyfrowania enigmy gdybyśmy nie znali niemieckiego.

1603284377_1DruyFehQkemWTK5XKuFRpXb3tz89.body:
> [leaks](#comment_8_129Djo6fqb7fviR6j7SC25e1m5fE4MbCQU): Cuba discovers it, they'll arrest people and shut down the entire internet and ask China for help with a new firewall. Good luck.

I'd be less surprised if US would try to do such a thing. For many countries such networks is a chance for independence from american-internet-infrastructure and for US it is a threat to a monopolistic practices.

> [77ha01](#comment_2_19RBy1R77se3kYGB4ZLXCVowdKrcqL1h4A): Countless dystopia movies show us the ultimate outcome of AI, but we still don't acknowledge the dangers. It's not even sci-fi anymore. Technology is evolving at a faster rate than we are unfortunately.

It would be silly to even try stopping progress.
But we can at least mitigate its exploitative potential by making sure such projects stay open source, by making open datasets and by fighting computer illiteracy in general public.

As for emotions, nope, those are coming from mortal flesh and desires. Computers don't have those.

> [styromaniac](#comment_3114_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): While content on ZeroNet can help, I don't see the reason for piracy here 

For me the reason is preatty simple:
-more content -> more people -> more content ...

While I realise that everything I've requested is licenced on CC licence or was released as a torrent anyway and is easy to get on clearnet. It's a way for independence from centralised network.

> [piracy](#comment_6_15brvpgJ5PFKGLF6976wR5gMd2ryzcg2wz): piracy is more tollerated

I would split the term piracy into "commercial piracy" and "non-commercial piracy" because knowledge and culture sharing AKA "non-commercial piracy" lays implicit to the idea of freedom of speech and basic human-human interaction.

> [zeroseed6b](#comment_4_1PYse2fs94EphqFApJnUCBPa4wMNTvTddn): Look at my cc content on galactichan

Ok, I've just started seeding it

I'm all in for promoting zeronet to CC content creators because CC licenses are more on track with today information exchange than outdated copyright. But also p2p webhosting brings "staying online" cost to a minimum. I mean bandwidth cost is shared among peers, DDOS problem is already solved, no domain name associated cost, and the beauty of this place is that even "abandoned content" is still reachable.
